result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A Gossar-Bernal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $150.00 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and court costs, leaving a balance of $429.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:14 pm
Defendant Samantha A Gossar-Bernal appeared in court and without counsel.
Defendant makes statement she was on a payment plan but missed some payments as a result of a home fire.
Court orders Defendant to pay $20 per month, beginning September 30, 2017, and continuing the last day of every month, until paid in full or contact Clerk of Courts office with reasonable explanation as to why payment cannot be paid.
Cour authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment plan.
Court adjourned at 1:16 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Samantha A Gossar-Bernal
Current: 330 W Main St  Apt 204, Omro, WI 54963-1248 United States  (Effective: 08-14-2017)
Prior: 925 Oregon  Apt 203, Oshkosh, WI 54902 United States
Summons for FTP Hearing mailed to Defendant has been returned via USPS.  Return to Sender.  Re-mailed to: 330 W Main St  Apt 204, Omro WI 54963-1248

ADDRESS INFO for Samantha A Gossar-Bernal
Current: 925 Oregon  Apt 203, Oshkosh, WI 54902 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2017)
Prior: 125 Quarry St Apt 3, Berlin, WI 54923
Releasing Funds - $150.00 to Clerk of Courts

1:42 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the delinguent and finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:47 p.m.

2:42 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - all motions were filed and still request a jury trial.  Court sets for Jury Trial on September 9, 2016 at 8:15 a.m. and Jury Status Hearing to be scheduled.  Order will be done and sent via mail.  

Court adjourned at 2:45 p.m.
dated June 27, 2016 - from Atty Barb Privat to Judge Slate.  List of jury instructions.

2:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests a date for a jury trial.  Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  All motions and witness lists are to be filed by July 1, 2016.

Court adjourned at 2:19 p.m.

1:43 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - this was possibly a mandatory appearance and defendant left a message yesterday that she has no ride.  Court will re-call.

Court adjourned at 1:44 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:23 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - spoke with defendant, states she did not receive the police reports that were sent and they were re-sent to her and will meet with the defendant to go over them.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 24, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  Mandatory appearance or warrant.

Court adjourned at  2:24 p.m.
Status hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

10:47 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and has discussed with the defendant and at this time the defendant is not going to accept the offer and would like to meet with the defendant again.  Atty Privat requests another hearing be scheduled.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 26, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:48 a.m.

11:17 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - received an offer but does not have Discovery.  Statement by ADA - Discovery is in her mailbox.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 8, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:18 a.m.

8:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court notes $150 cash bond has been posted and orders bond to continue.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 8, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:56 a.m.
